The Blessed One said this.
And in this connection it was said:
“One who develops loving-kindness,
mindful, with a well-concentrated mind,
His fetters are worn away,
seeing the destruction of acquisitions.

analyzed: ekam pi ce pāṇam a duṭṭha cittaḥ
translated: If one is without a mind of ill will,
one is skilled in that loving-kindness;
And if one has compassion for all beings,
the noble one makes much merit.
Those who have conquered the earth bounded by the ocean,
kings and sages who have gone about making sacrifices—
The horse sacrifice, the human sacrifice,
the sacrifice with the sacrificial cord and the sacrifice with the ladle.
Compared to the well-developed mind of loving-kindness,
they are not worth a sixteenth part,
like the light of the stars compared to the moon’s radiance.

analyzed: yaḥ na hanti na ghātā iti
translated: One who neither kills nor gets others to kill,
neither cuts nor gets others to cut,
who is full of loving-kindness towards all beings,
with no hostility towards anyone at all.

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
